customer_name: Twin Pine Farm and Exotics Conservation Foundation
site_name: Twin Pine Farm & Exotics Conservation Foundation

citations.narrative:
The primary enclosure housing one Ring-tailed lemur is less than three feet away from the enclosed porch structure that
serves as the perimeter fence for this area. Two sides of the primary enclosure are within inches of the screened-in porch
barrier, almost touching the primary enclosure itself. Having a perimeter fence in place protects the animals in the facility
by restricting animals and unauthorized persons from going through it or under it, permitting contact with the animals in
the facility. Additionally, it serves as a secondary containment system for the animals in the facility.
The facility shall ensure that the primary enclosures for the primates being housed outdoors are enclosed by a 6-foot
perimeter fence at least 3 feet in distance from the primary enclosure. Correct by July 15, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.78(d) 
   
Outdoor housing facilities. 
The primary enclosure housing one Ring-tailed lemur is less than three feet away from the enclosed porch structure that 
serves as the perimeter fence for this area. Two sides of the primary enclosure are within inches of the screened-in porch 
barrier, almost touching the primary enclosure itself. Having a perimeter fence in place protects the animals in the facility 
by restricting animals and unauthorized persons from going through it or under it, permitting contact with the animals in 
the facility. Additionally, it serves as a secondary containment system for the animals in the facility.  
The facility shall ensure that the primary enclosures for the primates being housed outdoors are enclosed by a 6-foot 
perimeter fence at least 3 feet in distance from the primary enclosure. Correct by July 15, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
